alert.note: Alert for Placer; Sacramento; Solano; Sutter; Yolo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 19 at 6:09PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions northern California, including the following counties, Placer, Sacramento, Solano, Sutter and Yolo. * WHEN...Until 915 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. CHP has reported flooding along some on and off ramps in the Sacramento area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sacramento, Roseville, Citrus Heights, Rocklin, Carmichael, West Sacramento, Lincoln, Rio Linda, Elverta, Arco Arena, North Highlands, Foothill Farms, Antelope, Pleasant Grove, Parkway-South Sacramento, Florin, Freeport, Laguna West- Lakeside, Sheridan and Paintersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
